listitem.para: SaxonJS is an XSLT 3.0 processor written (mostly) in JavaScript.
It runs both in the browser and on Node.js

chapter.title: Tutorial setup
chapter.para: The tutorial is available from the GitHub repository: . The README describes a number of options, but we’ll try the simplest thing first.

listitem.para: Open up a shell window and navigate to the directory where you cloned the repository. (Even when you’re doing the exercises, the server should always be started in the “top level” directory.)
Run ./gradlew pythonServerStart, if you prefer the Python version.
Run ./gradlew nodeServerStart, if you prefer the Node.js version.
Run ./gradlew dockerServerStart, if you prefer the Docker container version.
Open in your favorite (JavaScript enabled) web browser.

chapter.para: Do you see a “Click me” button? Does it work?

chapter.title: Orienting yourself
chapter.para: There are about five windows you’ll want to be able to see while you’re doing the tutorial:

If you have multiple screens, you’ll almost certainly benefit from spreading the windows around so that you can see them simultaneously. Barring that, you may want to close some other applications so that there are fewer windows to switch between.
